com.camerontec.util.collection.persisted.journaling

Class JournalingPersistentStoreVersionHistory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.util.collection.persisted.journaling.JournalingPersistentStoreVersionHistory

  • public class JournalingPersistentStoreVersionHistory
extends Object
    An instance of this class is used by JournalingPersistentStoreBase implementations to maintain an in-memory version history offset series, which is used to access version history up to a certain number of versions. This feature is only needed in HA mode, and therefore needs to be explicitly turned on by configuration.
    The version history offset series is implemented using a circular bounded buffer of offsets. Each time a new write request is encountered, its offset is added to the end of the buffer. Once the buffer is full, this causes the first value in the buffer to be evicted, which guarantees that we only ever retain a maximum of N offsets, N being given by the value of property version-history-size
